is a city in the Kheda district of

Santram Mandir (Hindu Temple). This is a very exciting place among the Hindu Pilgrims, its a place of divinity and peace. Despite being a Hindu Temple, Santram Mandir is a very highly respected establishment among all ethnic groups. Santram Mandir has a huge community of Volunteers, donors and devotees. All the donations are very well spent on public health care, food banks, seniors, education, recreation and many other social and cultural activities. 

The most touching aspect of the Santram Mandir Administration is that every individual is treated equal, without dividing them further into race and religions. 'Hats off' to the Santram Mandir Administration team for making every possible effort to maintain communal Harmony and Peace.

Eat PUFFs (Baked pastry with stuffed spicy potato paste) at Santram Bakery on College Road, and Punjab Bakery on Santram Road, pretty good. Don't forget to try coffee's and fast food @ the only cafe in Nadiad that is Java Green on college road, just across Santram bakery. It also has an internet cafe inside.

There are quite a few good restaurants in Nadiad. Woodlands on college road is one of them. In the last couple of years a new restaurant called Blueberry has started and becoming very popular. There are many other eateries across Nadiad, who also serve tasty Gujarati,Punjabi and South Indian dishes.

Don't forget to taste the delicious Paan (Betel leaf with coconut, fruit preserves, gulkand (rose petal preserves), various spices. May also include maraschino cherry. Alternatively, South Asian sweet paan may contain candied fruits and/or candy-coated fennel seeds) at Lovely Paan House. This is a very famous Paan shop since decades.
Drink LASSI (A sweet yogurt drink, very yummy) at this decades old place 'JaiKishan Lassi', near Railway Station.
